alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of far northwestern Franklin and northeastern St. Lawrence Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parishville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Massena, Parishville, Helena, Lawrenceville, Brasher Falls, Hopkinton, Brasher Center, Ironton, North Lawrence, Converse, Nicholville, Stockholm Center, Winthrop and Buckton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence
